messages.message:
those files help us lock in the version of the libraries we use. If we don’t lock versions, any downstream changes by these third-party libraries, may end up impacting us inadvertently, either by breaking builds, functionality changes, introduce security vulnerabilities, etc.
From Golang docs (https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/Modules#releasing-modules-all-versions): “Ensure your `go.sum` file is committed along with your `go.mod` file.” There’s also a section explaining why.
